item.title: Day 10:Zadar-Split
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
It was great exploring the city if Zadar and Split was even better. I find the Croatian coastal cities  magical. The atmosphere is so relaxed that there is no way that you don’t like it.The initial plan to ride around 50 km to Split  was suddenly changed because of a  small issue in the “Tequila …

Day 10:Zadar-Split Read More »
item.content:encoded:
It was great exploring the city if Zadar and Split was even better. I find the Croatian coastal cities  magical. The atmosphere is so relaxed that there is no way that you don’t like it.
The initial plan to ride around 50 km to Split  was suddenly changed because of a  small issue in the “Tequila Bar Hostel”. Although everything was perfect ,it happened that some small bed bugs  had a feast on my legs during the night. After complaining to the owner, he offered that instead cycling to Split, he will organize a mini van for me and my bike. I decided that it  is a good offer and a nice opportunity  to have some more time in Split before ending the tour and catching the bus to Struga.

The next two days i  spent in Split, relaxing, swimming and exploring the city. It was a perfect end of the adventure.
I got into the bus for an overnight ride to Struga full of memories and encouraged to plan another adventure. Morocco and Iran were already on my mind.

item.title: Day 9:Cres city (Cres Island)-Zadar
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
The plan for the day 28.05.2018 was:1.Ride from Cres till the end of the island Mali Losinj2.Locate the port and take the ferry “Jadrolinija”3.Arrive in Zadar and find a hostelFrom Cres to the port in “Mali Losinj” there are 50 km. I  arrived there in around 3 hours ,just in time to have a relaxed …

Day 9:Cres city (Cres Island)-Zadar Read More »
item.content:encoded:
The plan for the day 28.05.2018 was:
1.Ride from Cres till the end of the island Mali Losinj
2.Locate the port and take the ferry “Jadrolinija”
3.Arrive in Zadar and find a hostel
From Cres to the port in “Mali Losinj” there are 50 km. I  arrived there in around 3 hours ,just in time to have a relaxed coffee and catch the ferry. The time to Zadar is 6 hours. The “Jadrolinija” ferries are not newly built  but their design still keeps with the time. There is a big deck and the inside is comfortable enough to spend few hours. Most of the time i spent on the deck where i found my two American friends also traveling to Zadar.

Arrival in Zadar was around 9 p.m.  and i was lucky to have the Americans who organized the search for a  hostel.
“Tequila Bar” Hostel was in the heart of the town. I  didn’t  have force to go out but that’s why i had a nice  sleep and i was ready to explore the place  the next day.

item.title: Day 8:Merag-Cres
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
There is nothing better than to wake up  a few meters from the sea. The morning was very hot and it was clear that the temperature will go over 40 Celsius that day. Since i was not alone now, i had to be flexible and arrange my departing time. This took a while and by …

Day 8:Merag-Cres Read More »
item.content:encoded:
There is nothing better than to wake up  a few meters from the sea. The morning was very hot and it was clear that the temperature will go over 40 Celsius that day. Since i was not alone now, i had to be flexible and arrange my departing time. This took a while and by the time i was on the asphalt ,it was already 10 a.m. On my big surprise ,the island was one big mountain. The way to the city of Cress was mainly climbing with only the last few km downhill. Of course the biggest problem was the sun. The perspiration rate in this temperature is very high and you simply can not compensate with drinking water, not to say that the water supply was limited in those hills. One of the American guys had troubles with his bike and that further slowed us. Since the problem could not be corrected without a bike repair specialist, the two Americans found a minivan that will transport them to the city and from that moment i continued the ride alone.

The second part of the day was relaxed. First, because there were no more climbs  and second, because i reached my destination during day time so there was enough time to get lunch and jump in the water. Towards the of the day i decided that i should fine a wild camping away from  the city and so i crossed in the opposite side of the island where only rock and olive trees could be found. But that was what i looked after: quiet place near the water where i can relax alone. I found a perfect place, installed the tent and drank the 1 liter “Cvichek” Wine that Daniel gave me. Thank you Daniel!

item.title: Day 7:Trieste-Porozina(Cres Island)
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
From the camp to the city center took me a downhill road without moving the pedals. It was sunny early morning on 26.05.2018.The plan: drink Espresso in Trieste and head  through Istra all the way down to the Adriatic coast where i would take the ferry to Cres Island. I will also mention that the …

Day 7:Trieste-Porozina(Cres Island) Read More »
item.content:encoded:
From the camp to the city center took me a downhill road without moving the pedals. It was sunny early morning on 26.05.2018.The plan: drink Espresso in Trieste and head  through Istra all the way down to the Adriatic coast where i would take the ferry to Cres Island. I will also mention that the original plan was to ride a long the west coast of Istra and cross the cities of Pula and Rovinj but due to time constraints  the plan was changed with a shorter one.
Who doesn’t enjoy a good espresso on the sunny square of an Italian city? Italy has its magic with the relaxed atmosphere ,positive people ,good food and wine.

Crossing Istra was enjoyable for the most of its part. The final 20-30km until the Brestova port were hard. I was dehydrated, hungry and desperately wanted to see the sea expecting than once i arrive in the islands there will be no more mountains .I had to speed up and arrive in the port until 8 p.m. because that was the time when the last ferry to the island of Cres departed. I arrived there 10 minutes before 20 p.m. happy to be  just on time.
Once on the ferry, i met two American guys who were also making Island hoping and spent the night and next day with them. We found a hidden and remote beach near Merag city, and installed our tents.

item.title: Day 6:Mihelca-Trieste
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
Daniel has a large house  and two very beautiful “Siberian Samoyed” dogs. He offered me to stay there one more day and i decided to accept the invitation. I used this time to have a  nice rest and walk around the village and in the woods together with Daniel. Slovenia is very green country and …

Day 6:Mihelca-Trieste Read More »
item.content:encoded:
Daniel has a large house  and two very beautiful “Siberian Samoyed” dogs. He offered me to stay there one more day and i decided to accept the invitation. I used this time to have a  nice rest and walk around the village and in the woods together with Daniel. Slovenia is very green country and the month of May its simply magical. I envied Daniel that he lives in  so clean and quiet place. One day i will look for something similar for me.
In the evening we played Picado in  a local bar with very beautiful girl whose name was Leticia.
During our time together, the “Cvichek” was with us all the time. On leaving, Daniel gave me one liter to carry it on the bike. We said goodbye with a hope on another meeting once again in near future.
Another 120 km were in front of me, on the road to Trieste, Italy, this time without mountains. The large mountains in Slovenia are in  its Northwest part where  the  highest peak “Triglav” is situated. I am lucky to have avoided it. Instead,i was riding on a flat road, past Ljubljana and  the famous  cave “Postojnska Jama”.

Late in the evening i entered the suburbs  of Trieste. The camp site was on the top of the hill from where  there  was a nice panoramic view on the sea and the city. The local camp restaurant was  full off guests and although i had my avocado prepared, i still ordered some fresh calamari. The avocado sandwich in the tent was serving like a desert. On this kind of days no amount of food is too much.

item.title: Day 5:Maribor-Mihelca
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
I left Maribor around 9 a.m. on May 23rd 2018:destination Mihelca.Mihelca is a small village hidden high in the mountains on around 30 km from Ljubljana. One friend of mine recommended this place , and he found for me accommodation in the house of a Macedonian guy who turned out to be living with his …

Day 5:Maribor-Mihelca Read More »
item.content:encoded:
I left Maribor around 9 a.m. on May 23rd 2018:destination Mihelca.
Mihelca is a small village hidden high in the mountains on around 30 km from Ljubljana. One friend of mine recommended this place , and he found for me accommodation in the house of a Macedonian guy who turned out to be living with his family in this  place.
On the way to the village i passed the city of Celje which is among the bigger cities in Slovenia. I had  doubts to stay there for one night but after seeing around ,decided that there is not much to do in this place and if i stay i will loose my time. That’s why after the lunch break in the local “kafana” i continued towards the high mountains. I phoned my host, Daniel,  and he informed me that  from Celje to Mihelca there are four  big climbs and  most probably i can not make it one day. But  i considered it as a challenge and decided to try. The road crosses  the river Sava a  few times and after that, starts climbing up. It took me the whole day to come close to the village but still there was no road sign  from it. I relied completely on Google maps.
It was around 20 pm and  it started getting dark when i reached the end of the road , deep inside the Slovenian mountains. I got afraid that this is the wrong road and probably i will have to sleep in the mountain with the bears. In the last moment, a car appeared and the people  in it informed me that they know personally Daniel and they will take me to him. That was  a  huge relief. I met Daniel and his young son who had long hair and a bow like Indians in the western movies. Daniel loved the local wine “Cvichek” and he took me directly to try it in the yard in of his friend’s house which was a local winery as well.

item.title: Day 4:Bad Radkersburg-Maribor
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
The sunny day from that morning quickly turned into rain and slowed down my progress. I had a raincoat but still you can  not go far away when it rains. The plan was to reach Maribor as soon as possible for that day. According to the plan ,it should take 50 km and i should …

Day 4:Bad Radkersburg-Maribor Read More »
item.content:encoded:
The sunny day from that morning quickly turned into rain and slowed down my progress. I had a raincoat but still you can  not go far away when it rains. The plan was to reach Maribor as soon as possible for that day. According to the plan ,it should take 50 km and i should have been there  in the  late afternoon, have a rest and go in the city in some coffee bar. But the progress was slow again. I encountered a highway and i had to find an alternative way  in order to cross the Slovenian border.
Like the other days, i reached Maribor around 20 pm. The camp that i  found was at the end of the city and there was no possibility that i go and have fun that night. It is a pity that i didn’t see the city of Maribor like it really deserves. It is because of my lack of experience and of course the limited amount of time that i had to finish this trip. In my opinion, this kind of trips should be done relaxed  and without feeling the pressure that on that and that day you have to  return home.
I only managed  to go in a restaurant, had a really nice dinner and get to back to the tent. Maribor will wait for another sunny day!

item.title: Day 3:Hartberg-Bad Radkersburg
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
Bad Radkersburg is a small  typical Austrian town only a few kilometers from the Slovenian border. The actual distance from Hartberg is around   70 km ,but  that day i made 133 km because i missed the road many times. It was hard day. My leg started hurting from the effort and  i couldn’t even seat …

Day 3:Hartberg-Bad Radkersburg Read More »
item.content:encoded:
Bad Radkersburg is a small  typical Austrian town only a few kilometers from the Slovenian border. The actual distance from Hartberg is around   70 km ,but  that day i made 133 km because i missed the road many times. It was hard day. My leg started hurting from the effort and  i couldn’t even seat on the saddle because of the  ass pain. The region is mainly mountains but there are no big steep climbs. At the beginning of the day i hoped to reach Maribor but that was unrealistic. Somewhere after 20 pm, i reached this small town, Bad Radkersburg and found a camp ground which had a restaurant on the side. I was so tired and hungry that i didn’t care how much i will spend, just to get a good food .I ordered two or three times and had a few beers. The camp was great. I had a really good and quiet sleep in my tent. The camps in Austria are good  but pricey as well. I was paying on average 14 euros for a night  for sleeping on the ground in own tent. But you have electricity to charge your phone and you have a shower which is extremely important for a long summer day.

I woke up  on a fresh sunny day and after the usual routine, i went to the supermarket to buy some food for breakfast and also for the day later. I must mention  that in this kind of occasions one of the foods that i use often is the avocado. I even think that i could not survive without it. It has a lot of calories ,it is healthy and it is tasty. I make an avocado sandwich  with gouda cheese and i am ready to climb Mount Everest. The avocado is the king!

item.title: Day 2:Bad Vöslau -Hartberg
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
Hartberg lies in around 100 km from Bad Vöslau in a mountainous region in east Austria. The mountains are not that high like the Austrian alps on the west, but still they include a few steep climbs. In general ,the first 50 km wере enjoyable with a few nice places to stop and rest in …

Day 2:Bad Vöslau -Hartberg Read More »
item.content:encoded:
Hartberg lies in around 100 km from Bad Vöslau in a mountainous region in east Austria. The mountains are not that high like the Austrian alps on the west, but still they include a few steep climbs. In general ,the first 50 km wере enjoyable with a few nice places to stop and rest in nature with hammocks and benches.
Like on my previous day, i was struggling to follow the Eurovelo 9 route in order to be safe and avoid traffic. However the route is  not clearly marked in many places and its easy to miss . So it was in my case as well. I had to turn back few times ,lose time and make unnecessary kilometers. Along the road i had a tire puncture and just before it got dark, i had problem with my rear derailleur which went in the wheel and almost broke. It was twisted to the breakpoint, but somehow it stayed alive. A local young man saw my trouble and helped me with tools to correct the problem. I was extremely thankful to him and i will remember him forever. If i didn’t receive help ,who knows where i would have spent the night in those mountains where i don’t think there is local bike shop. I was lucky again.

Around  8 p.m. i finally reached the city of Hartberg and found the local camp. It was a nice place with good sanitary conditions. I installed the tent, had a nice dinner and enjoyed the evening. The local mosquitos were a disturbance, but once was in the tent, they couldn’t reach their meal.

item.title: Day1: Vienna-Bad Vöslau
item.dc:creator: sivevsky
item.description:
In the above picture is  the situation in which my bike was when i first arrived in hotel Meininger  on  18.05.2018.My plan was to assemble the bike and get it ready for an early morning departure next day. But it was not so simple. Besides  messing up the brakes, i realized that my newly bought  …

Day1: Vienna-Bad Vöslau Read More »
item.content:encoded:
In the above picture is  the situation in which my bike was when i first arrived in hotel Meininger  on  18.05.2018.
My plan was to assemble the bike and get it ready for an early morning departure next day. But it was not so simple. Besides  messing up the brakes, i realized that my newly bought  Vodafone  sim card is not functioning and i don’t have Internet. It was essential that i have internet since i didn’t bring any paper maps and without it, i  could simply not find my way. I spent almost  the whole morning trying to connect the sim card but it was useless and i went to the shop and bought a new one.
Vienna has a territory of around 400  square kilometers and it took me more than 1 hour just to get out of the city. It was clear  that i can not reach far that day.

My major concern during the whole trip in Austria was to follow the Eurovelo 9 route which is an exclusive road for bicycles that starts from Scandinavia and ends in Greece. It turned out that in many places it was a gravel road and not  asphalt like i expected. My bike was not fully fit for this kind of surface and as a result a had a few tire punctures during the trip.
In Germany and Austria you can see many so called bike gardens where local people come with their bikes and drink beer.
I gave my every effort to reach Wiener Neustadt that day but i was short for around 20-30 km and decided that it was time to get some food and find a place to sleep.
I was very lucky to find the only camp in that area. This was the first time that i used my tent and i had difficulties setting it up. The camp owner  helped me somehow and i was ready for sleep. I am wandering what could have been like, if i decided instead of camp , to do a wild camping that night? Since i could not  set the tent alone ,there was a big chance that i would freeze during the night because  it turned out that although it was  the month of May, the temperatures were close to zero degrees  and even though  i put on me everything i had as clothes ,i still  was not warm in the tent. Luckily i had no health problems the next morning. The day was sunny and  i felt fresh and ready to go on.
